Package cp213

Class SingleStack<T>

java.lang.Object
cp213.SingleLink<T>
cp213.SingleStack<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the SingleStack value type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>
public class SingleStack<T>
extends SingleLink<T>
COMPLETE THE CODE AT // your code here A simple linked stack structure of Node T objects. Only the T value contained in the stack is visible through the standard stack methods. Extends the SingleLink class. Note that the rear attribute should be ignored as the rear is not used in a stack.
Version:
2021-06-16
Author:
// your name, id, email here

  • Constructor Details

    • SingleStack

  • Method Details

    • combine

      public void combine​(SingleStack<T> left, SingleStack<T> right)
      Combines the contents of the left and right SingleStacks into the current SingleStack. Moves nodes only - does not refer to values in any way, or call the high-level methods pop or push. left and right SingleStacks are empty when done. Nodes are moved alternately from left and right to this SingleStack. You have two source stacks named left and right. Move all nodes from these two stacks to the current stack. It does not make a difference if the current stack is empty or not, just get nodes from the right and left stacks and add them to the current stack. You may use any appropriate SingleLink helper methods available. Do not assume that both right and left stacks are of the same length.
      Parameters:
      left - The first SingleStack to extract nodes from.
      right - The second SingleStack to extract nodes from.

    • pop

      public T pop()
      Returns the top value of the stack and removes that value from the stack. The next node in the stack becomes the new top node. Decrements the stack length.
      Returns:
      The value at the top of the stack.

    • push

      public void push​(T value)
      Adds value to the top of the stack. Increments the stack length.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to add to the top of the stack.

    • splitAlternate

      public void splitAlternate​(SingleStack<T> left, SingleStack<T> right)
      Splits the contents of the current SingleStack into the left and right SingleStacks. Moves nodes only - does not move value or call the high-level methods insert or remove. this SingleStack is empty when done. Nodes are moved alternately from this SingleStack to left and right. left and right may already contain values. This is the opposite of the combine method.
      Parameters:
      left - The first SingleStack to move nodes to.
      right - The second SingleStack to move nodes to.
